content.raw: A singleton shouldn't have a public constructor or destructor. Take a look at [this singleton template](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebo/src/381eab2df00b06c414534a1e1c06920d6475c987/gazebo/common/SingletonT.hh?at=default).
content.html: A singleton shouldn't have a public constructor or destructor. Take a look at this singleton template.
Avoiding public constructor/destructors in 6a280d9 and 13eeabe.

content.raw: Most other functions in this library return booleans. Is there a reason to return an integer for this function instead of a boolean?
content.html: Most other functions in this library return booleans. Is there a reason to return an integer for this function instead of a boolean?

content.raw: This is a leftover from a previous approach where I was returning an int. Changed to bool in df0582b.
content.html: This is a leftover from a previous approach where I was returning an int. Changed to bool in df0582b.

content.raw: Is the the `major` version number, or `major.minor`?

This is just the version of the discovery protocol, which might be different from the library version. What we can do is to consider the discovery version as the major version of the library. Does it sound reasonable?
content.html: This is just the version of the discovery protocol, which might be different from the library version. What we can do is to consider the discovery version as the major version of the library. Does it sound reasonable?

content.raw:
I did a quick search in czmq and they seem to provide hooks for disabling the interrupt handler.

http://czmq.zeromq.org/manual:zsys

I tried really quick but it didn't work for me. I'll try again and file an issue or ask in their list.

content.raw:
I found that [this works](http://lists.zeromq.org/pipermail/zeromq-dev/2013-January/019979.html).

I've added the above in commit 85537d9, along with two example programs.

content.raw: Thanks Nate, merged. I also made some changes in the way the library terminates. Now, the only starting point for termination is the Node destructor. ee21453
content.html: Thanks Nate, merged. I also made some changes in the way the library terminates. Now, the only starting point for termination is the Node destructor. ee21453

content.raw: Could you add accessors to `Node` to get the advertised and subscribed topics?
content.html: Could you add accessors to Node to get the advertised and subscribed topics?

content.raw: Added in 1d2e444 including also the list of advertised services. Note that a topic is considered subscribed if the node knows at least one publisher's address for the topic.
content.html: Added in 1d2e444 including also the list of advertised services. Note that a topic is considered subscribed if the node knows at least one publisher's address for the topic.

content.raw:
There is no notion of one-to-one mapping between topic name and message type, correct? For example, you could advertise the "/foo" topic, and publish two different protobuf messages on the topic.

I'm asking because I think such an implementation has some flaws. System introspection would be difficult, and there is no error checking to make sure a publisher is sending good information to a subscriber.
content.html:
There is no notion of one-to-one mapping between topic name and message type, correct? For example, you could advertise the "/foo" topic, and publish two different protobuf messages on the topic.

I'm asking because I think such an implementation has some flaws. System introspection would be difficult, and there is no error checking to make sure a publisher is sending good information to a subscriber.

content.raw: This is captured in this [issue](https://bitbucket.org/ignitionrobotics/ign_transport/issue/1/type-checking). I'll start implementing it soon.
content.html: This is captured in this issue. I'll start implementing it soon.

content.html: Updated: Issues addressed and examples for testing service calls added in 0d2f8b0.

content.raw: The tests pass on mac and the examples work. It just requires [ign_msgs pull request 1](https://bitbucket.org/ignitionrobotics/ign_msgs/pull-request/1/use-libc-with-clang). Once these are merged, we should tag and release ign_msgs and this.
content.html: The tests pass on mac and the examples work. It just requires ign_msgs pull request 1. Once these are merged, we should tag and release ign_msgs and this.

content.raw: Let's hold off on tagging and releasing these packages until after we have branched gazebo 4.0. There are a few more changes I want to make to ign_msgs.
content.html: Let's hold off on tagging and releasing these packages until after we have branched gazebo 4.0. There are a few more changes I want to make to ign_msgs.

content.raw: I just made one last update in 21c0c92. It fixes some problems in Mac OS. @nkoenig , I changed the way we disabled the signal catching in czmq because the way we were doing it triggers an assertion in the last cmzq version. This patch should allow us to use the latest versions easily. I tested with the latest czmq version and it seems to work.
content.html: I just made one last update in 21c0c92. It fixes some problems in Mac OS. @nkoenig , I changed the way we disabled the signal catching in czmq because the way we were doing it triggers an assertion in the last cmzq version. This patch should allow us to use the latest versions easily. I tested with the latest czmq version and it seems to work.

content.raw: Thanks for all the comments. Merged!
